write_code.title: Sum Two Numbers
write_code.description: Write a function called 'sum_numbers' that takes two numbers as parameters and returns their sum. Then test it with sum_numbers(10, 5).
write_code.hint: Use the + operator to add the numbers, and make sure to print the result of calling the function.

write_code.title: Print Even Numbers
write_code.description: Write code that prints all even numbers from 2 to 10 (one number per line).
write_code.hint: Use a for loop with range() and check if each number is divisible by 2 using the modulo operator (%).

write_code.title: Find Maximum
write_code.description: Write a function called 'find_max' that takes a list of numbers and returns the largest number. Test it with find_max([3, 7, 2, 9, 1]).
write_code.hint: You can use Python's built-in max() function or write a loop to find the largest number.

write_code.title: Multiply Numbers
write_code.description: Write a function called 'multiply' that takes two numbers and returns their product. Then test it with multiply(6, 7).
write_code.hint: Use the * operator to multiply the numbers, and don't forget to console.log the result.

write_code.title: Count to Five
write_code.description: Write code that uses a for loop to print numbers from 1 to 5 (one number per line).
write_code.hint: Use a for loop with a counter variable. Remember JavaScript for loops: for(let i = 1; i <= 5; i++)
